metadata.dc:title: Profile of co-morbidity, control level, health care resources use and of cardiovascular event presence in subjects with arterial hypertension in a health primary care setting
metadata.dc:description: Objective: Todeterminecomorbidity,degreeofcontrolandcostsaccordingtothepresence/absence ofcardiovascularevents(CVE)inprimaryhealthcare(PHC)patientswith hypertension(HT).Patients andmethods: A retrospectivemulticenterstudy.Patientsaged 430 yearsfromfive PHCteamswereincludedin2006.Comparativecohort:generalpopulation.Mainmeasures: CVE,CharlsonComorbidityIndex(severity),comorbidity(AdjustedClinicalGroups), clinicalparameters(bloodpressure,lipids,glycemia,etc.)anddegreeofcontrol.Optimal control(o140/90, and r130/80mmHgindiabeticsandpatientswithCVE)andmoderate control(r140/90 mmHg)wasestablishedaccordingtoNCEP-ATPIIIcriteria.Amodel ofdirectcostswasestablished,differentiatingbetweenfixedandvariable(drugs,tests andreferrals)costs.ModelswerecorrectedusinglogisticregressionanalysisandANCOVAtests,withalevelofsignificancepo0.05.Results: In total57,025patientswereincluded,ofwhom26.5%(95%confidenceintervals,[CI]: 25.8–27.2%) hadHT.Hypertensiveshadahigherage(67.6vs.49.5years),proportionof women(56.9%vs.54.0%),generalmorbidity(7.1vs.4.2episodes/year)andCharlsonComorbidity Index(0.9%vs.0.3%),po0,001. HTwasindependentlyassociatedwithobesity(OR ¼ 2.9), diabetes(OR ¼ 2.1), dyslipidemia(OR ¼ 1.9), CVE(OR ¼ 1.3) andage(OR ¼ 1.1). Optimalcontrolwasobservedin52%ofpatients(56.0%withoutCVEand35.1% withCVE,po0.001). Themeanunitcostwas457.90eurosinthegeneralpopulation,1,171.80 eurosinpatientswithHTand1,757.09eurosinpatientswithCVE.Theadjustedmean unitcost(ANCOVA)was565.29euros,870.21h and 1,504.35euros,respectively,po0,001. Thesedifferencesweremaintainedforallcostcomponents.Conclusions: Optimal controlcanstillbeimproved.PatientswithHTconsumealargeamount ofhealthresources.HTshouldbeconsideredtogetherwithothercardiovascularrisk factors(AU)
